To me, the word “hottest” makes the question a little more specific. It’s normal within anime to design characters with a certain brand of attractiveness. It’s really more the exception rather than the rule to make characters, male or female, attractive in accordance with some particular variety of tastes. This can include things that are attractive in a generic sense (by generic, I mean according to highly common tastes), but then there are those who are designed to appeal to more specific tastes like ‘lolicons’ or ‘meganekko’… but beyond that, you have categories of attractiveness. I consider “hot” to be one such category that involves not just being designed as attractive, but also having a character that exudes factors of sex appeal. I’ll expand on this a little later, but to begin with, let me at least explain what I don’t consider “hot” specifically. To me, characters like Kuriyama Mirai from Kyoukai no Kanata would qualify as “cute”, but that is not the same thing as “hot.” There’s an appeal to her cuteness and it also adds to the comedic value of the series that she is as cute as she is, but that is not “hot” in my view.  And likewise, a character like Violet from Violet Evergarden is what I’d consider designed as “pretty” rather than “hot” per se. Quite a lot of her appeal is also bolstered by the utterly gorgeous artwork in the series and thematic aspects that just make her transformation as a character a bright spot in a dark story… but again, it’s not necessarily “hot.”  I also include Violet in this comparison specifically for a reason, though. Violet has a lot in her design that draws a considerable degree of similarity to Saber from the Fate series, as you can see below —  Now Saber as a character does have at least one of the characteristics that I associate with “sexiness” of a female character (namely, the air of strength), but the thing is that other aspects that make for a character who I’d call “hot” are NOT part of her character. The idea of a sexy Saber in alluring poses with gratuitous fanservice doesn’t really work that well because it’s just not what makes up Saber the way her character is written. Again, doesn’t fit the mold of “hot.” So when I think about the female characters who are “hot” in the majority of anime I have watched, I think of a few things. And for any one character who makes my list, they may not necessarily have all the qualities at once, but at least has some combination of them. For one, there’s the actual physical component, which I feel is fairly obvious. Characters who possess some of the basics aspects of physically attractive women would fit this mold. Now it is normal in anime for many of these things to be scaled up beyond the limits of reality, and what I generally prefer fall within some bounds of reason, at least as far as anime itself has the potentiality to offer. In much the same way that anime eyes are typically scaled up in order to give more room to those expressive elements, often times, characters who are meant to exude sex appeal of some kind will have those physical characteristics exaggerated. Likewise, there are characters who are just comically over-the-top to the point of being objects of ridicule let alone actually presenting some sort of sex appeal, so characters like those in shows like Eikenbu Yori Ai wo Komete are not really within consideration. Other forms of this physical appeal include an air of strength, which could be embodied in the character’s actions/behavior (as it was with Saber), but could also be a product of an athletic physique. Might be a personal thing, but I find strength really sexy. Given that this is a subjective question by nature, it’s only inevitable that personal opinions are part of the picture. Secondly, there is the demeanor and behavior. There has to be something about the way the character acts that draws the viewer in and/or speaks to their nature as a sexual being. A number of people have included, for instance, Mikasa from Shingeki no Kyojin. And while her athletic physique and strength are things I find undeniably sexy, sexuality is not a part of her character. There is no component of her behavior or demeanor that aims to appeal to anyone on a sexual level, so I actually don’t quite count her in the “hot” group unless we’re confining solely to the physical component. That’s just not part of her character. On the other hand, a few people posted Nakiri Alice from Shokugeki no Soma. While sex appeal is not part of her agency as a character, the fact that she frequently cops seductive expressions, and shows confidence in a form that leans almost dominatrix-like, albeit without the more fetish-y components of the same. A bit of an odd one is Satou Sakie from Demi-chan wa Kataritai. She is a succubus, and she quite literally oozes sex appeal according to the storyline, but at the same time, she is trying everything in her power to prevent that. Anyway, having said all that, here are a few characters I put on the list of “hot.” Granted, there are probably several others I could put up there, but since we are talking about the top, I have to limit my list. Also, sometimes, the quality of the show plays into how I view the hotness of the characters. It’s all well and good to take a character like Saeko from Highschool of the Dead just on pictures and call her hot, but the show itself is so ridiculous that it makes it hard to watch, which in turn kills it for me. I mean… prehensile breasts that can somehow dodge bullets? Yeah… sure. Whatever. So here are two classics I have to include — Faye Valentine from Cowboy Bebop   and Mine Fujiko from Lupin III   I include both of them together because they both fit into the list for more or less the same reasons. In both cases, they are physically attractive, but they are also sly and clever as both are basically thieves and cons on some level or other. The thing about behavior/demeanor — both of these ladies, while they do engage in combat from time to time, their principal weapons are their charms. They aren’t merely sexy, but they make use of that sex appeal in productive ways. Also, there is something to be said for the classics. Fujiko, in particular has this title of being “the original” hottie of anime series, and for good reason. Sure, the dated art style might make her look a little weird compared to more modern designs, but it’s hard to hide what she’s all about. Faye is a similar story. When introduced, she is using her charms to play cons back and forth and even as one move fails, she just plays another one. Sometimes, she’s foxy and sometimes, she is tricky like a fox. Now getting a little more up to date, I have to include two characters from the Ikkitousen series. Okay, it’s kind of a given the Ikkitousen is one of those animes that is all about fanservice, sexy ladies, NSFW camera angles, and mysteriously self-destructing clothing. So as far as characters carrying themselves in ways to play to their sex appeal, that’s almost a forgone conclusion. The two that I pick both hold certain qualities that stand out from the rest. First of them is Kan’u Unchou (Japanese reading of Guan Yu [Yunchang])   Ummm… I rest my case. In all seriousness, the extent to which she oozes sex appeal is entirely physical. It’s not just that she carries herself and dresses in revealing clothes and repeatedly loses them in combat. She’s also a super-powerful character within the series who stands head and shoulders above several and carries a commanding presence among those characters that effectively makes her the center of attention. Also, there’s a geeky factor in that she’s supposed to be the reincarnation of Guan Yu, who holds a sort of unrivaled fame for being touted as the God of War in Chinese history. So her strength and commanding presence is a reflection of that name. Similarly, her long raven hair is a reflection of the fact that one of Guan Yu’s defining characteristics was a long beard. The other character I include from Ikkitousen is Kaku Bunwa (Japanese reading of Jia Xu [Wenhe])   There are a number of sexy characters in anime who are teases and try to mess with the protagonist in various ways. But I include Kaku on this because she isn’t merely a tease — she is seriously using her own sexuality as a tool. Her historical counterpart in Chinese history is Jia Xu, who was often lauded as an advisor who always found the most pragmatic solution to everything. Kaku as a character is much the same. She posseses nowhere near the mythical combat strength of many of the other characters in the show, but she knows how to use what she does have to good effect. She manipulates and gets in the good graces of people mainly by using her charms, and yes, her body as well. The point is that she’s the sort of character who is written such that she’s not just “hot”, but she’s hot and she knows it. Moving on, there’s another character who I’d liken to Kan’u, in the sense of her being attractive on a physical level, but also carries a commanding presence as a result of her overwhelming strength. That would be Erza Scarlet from Fairy Tail.   One thing I love about her character is that she is just as prone to fight with her superhuman strength as she is to let loose and be an ordinary woman from time to time. She has her mythical warrior qualities as befits her presence in the show, but also has typical human qualities. In a lot of ways, it adds to her appeal in that she becomes a little bit more relatable and not just a collection of tropes. So far, though, I’ve had to go back at least a few years, if not decades in the first two cases. Keeping in the range of very recent anime, though, there’s one character who just oozes sex appeal in a way that makes it seem natural for her character. That would be Fubuki from OnePunch Man.   So this is a good example of what I was referring to with the demeanor and the devilishly alluring way in which she presents herself. She’s not explicitly trying to bewitch people with her looks, but she is trying to present a confidence and a sense of standing above people (which is kind of a facade, but it is part of what she does), and that just adds to it.
